articles.author: Grady McGregor
articles.title: China deploys a favorite weapon in the coronavirus crisis: A crackdown on VPNs
articles.description: Virtual private networks that let Internet users bypass government censors are coming under fire.

articles.author: McKenna Moore
articles.title: The Olympics have a $900 million reserve fund for canceled games
articles.description: It’s unlikely, but as the coronavirus outbreak continues to spread, canceling the 2020 games becomes more of an option.

articles.author: Sy Mukherjee
articles.title: The first U.S. trial for a coronavirus treatment has started
articles.description: Gilead's antiviral remdesivir is being used in the first U.S. clinical trial to treat COVID-19, the disease caused by the new coronavirus.

articles.author: Naomi Xu Elegant
articles.title: Japan taps an unexpected drugmaker for its coronavirus treatment

articles.author: Adam Lashinsky
articles.title: Big Tech can’t outrun the coronavirus
articles.description: Apple, Amazon and Facebook aren't immune to worries that the contagion is spreading worldwide.

articles.author: David Meyer
articles.title: Europe’s coronavirus response is very different from China’s
articles.description: The Covid-19 outbreak in northern Italy has so far elicited an official response far more modest than Beijing's heavy-handed restrictions.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: Economists pegged the cost of a global coronavirus pandemic at $1 trillion. It could go much higher
articles.description: Economists are beginning to war game what an untethered outbreak could mean for global growth.

articles.author: eamonbarrett
articles.title: Is the coronavirus a ‘pandemic’? The World Health Organization can’t seem to make up its mind
articles.description: The agency is sending mixed messages with its vocabulary.

articles.author: Chris Morris
articles.title: Coronavirus has video game giants rethinking their trade show plans
articles.description: Sony and Oculus pull out of GDC. What’s next?

articles.author: Anne Sraders
articles.title: As coronavirus ravages the stock market, here are the biggest losers (and a few surprising winners)
articles.description: Airlines, cruise stocks, healthcare companies and tech companies like Apple all saw a brutal sell off.
